parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
Worthy, worthy of, deserving, comparable, suitable. Probably from ago; deserving, comparable or suitable.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Plural
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
Lord, master, sir; the Lord. From kuros; supreme in authority, i.e. controller; by implication, Master.
And, even, also, namely.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.
(a) I receive, get, (b) I take, lay hold of.
From the base of dokeo; glory, in a wide application.
And, even, also, namely.
A price, honor. From tino; a value, i.e. Money paid, or valuables; by analogy, esteem, or the dignity itself.
And, even, also, namely.
From dunamai; force; specially, miraculous power.
Neuter of hostis as conjunction; demonstrative, that; causative, because.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative 2nd Person Singular
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: To create, form, shape, make, always of God. Probably akin to ktaomai; to fabricate, i.e. Found.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
A primary preposition denoting the channel of an act; through.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Singular
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
An act of will, will; plur: wishes, desires. From the prolonged form of ethelo; a determination, i.e. choice or inclination.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To create, form, shape, make, always of God. Probably akin to ktaomai; to fabricate, i.e. Found.
